intro: Daphne delphini, commonly known as the sea daphne, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often woody and branched. Daphne delphini is known for its toxic properties, making it a plant that requires caution when handling.
